summary: This is a cover email from an Assistant United States Attorney to Judge Nathan, submitting an ex parte sealed letter pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16(d)(1) in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The attached letter is requested to be filed under seal.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The email is addressed to Judge Nathan for consideration of an ex parte sealed letter in the case US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is submitting the ex parte sealed letter to Judge Nathan in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Government ex parte discovery letter submission
events.description: The Government submits an ex parte sealed letter to Judge Nathan pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16(d)(1) in the case US v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a cover email for an ex parte sealed letter submitted to Judge Nathan in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The letter is submitted pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 16(d)(1), which governs protective orders in criminal discovery.
The Government requests the letter be filed under seal, indicating sensitive or confidential information.
The submission date is September 15, 2020, with the attached letter dated September 14, 2020.
The case involves Ghislaine Maxwell, though she is not explicitly named in this text snippet.
